messages.content: ComfyUI_CustomNet is a custom node for ComfyUI that allows object customization with variable viewpoints in text-to-image diffusion models.
To install ComfyUI_CustomNet, navigate to the .\ComfyUI \ custom_node directory and run the command: git clone https://github.com/smthemex/ComfyUI_CustomNet.git
What are the requirements for running ComfyUI_CustomNet?
The main requirement for running ComfyUI_CustomNet is carvekit-colab==4.1.0, which is a built-in background removal toolkit.
Where should I place the downloaded customnet_v1.pth model file?
The downloaded customnet_v1.pth model file should be placed in the ComfyUI/models/checkpoints/ directory.
Where can I find the clip and carvekit model files after downloading them for the first time?

The clip model file is usually located at C:/User/YourUsername/.cache/clip/ViT-L-14.pt, while the two carvekit background removal models are located at C:/User/YourUsername/.cache/carvekit/checkpoints/fba/fba_matting.pth and C:/User/YourUsername/.cache/carvekit/checkpoints/tracer_b7/tracer_b7.pth.
What kind of object image achieves the best effect with ComfyUI_CustomNet?
Object images with a white background achieve the best effect when using ComfyUI_CustomNet.
How is the citation for CustomNet formatted?

The citation for CustomNet is formatted as follows: @misc{yuan2023customnet, title={CustomNet: Zero-shot Object Customization with Variable-Viewpoints in Text-to-Image Diffusion Models}, author={Ziyang Yuan and Mingdeng Cao and Xintao Wang and Zhongang Qi and Chun Yuan and Ying Shan}, year={2023}, eprint={2310.19784}, archivePrefix={arXiv}, primaryClass={cs.CV}}
